intro: Protium nicaraguense, commonly known as the Nicaraguan tamarind. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Central America, particularly found in Nicaragua, Honduras, and Costa Rica. The plant belongs to the Burseraceae family, characterized by its aromatic resins and tropical habitat. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and革质 (leathery), with a dark green upper surface and a lighter underside. The flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in panicles, while the fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release seeds.
